column4: hey, do you guys know how i can "uninstall" a program after i have installed it.. (not through synaptic)
the problem is that i cant run the program, i know its there, i watched it install but when i try to do what you just said it just says it couldnt find the package
might i ask which program it is?
and how did you install it?
try to locate a vmware binary. did the guide say where it would be installed to?
just out of curiosity, why did you download vmware and not use a preconfigured virtualisation solution from the repositories?
becuase i found a guide on how to run XP in VMware server, and followed that. Im very new to linux..

just download the vmware version from the repositories. that will already be configured to work on your system. i myself am a big fan of qemu (another virtualisation software and also in the repositories)
yes i read up on the subject of virualization and decided to try out Xen instead, but i figured its not that smart to have VMware still partly installed.. Thats why i wanna get rid of it
i just worry what the installer did. i don't much trust third-party installers. if you install xen, there's a 99% chance that any problems you have with it won't have anything to do with vmware
it wasnt third party, it was the official release from VMware.. But ok then ill just ignore it, and try to run Xen instead..
maybe there's a vmware uninstall script in $HOME/vmware. it's certainly worth a look
lol how stupid of me not to check that right away.. there is an uninstall in the dir..
what did you say you used for virtualization?
and will it be able to run xp in it?
